sen.j: 刺し子（さしこ）とは、手芸の一分野で、布地に糸で幾何学模様等の図柄を刺繍して縫いこむこと。
sen.e: "Sashiko" is one area of handcrafts, embroidering patterns such as geometrical designs on fabrics with threads.
sen.cmt: 「刺繍する」と「縫いこむ」は意味が重複していると判断し、「刺繍して縫いこむ」->「刺繍する」と訳出しました。
sen.e: "Sashiko" is one area of handcrafts, embroidering patterns such as geometrical designs on fabrics with threads.
"Sashiko" (an old needlework technology) is one area of handcrafts, embroidering patterns such as geometrical designs on fabrics with threads.

sen.j: 保温、補強等のため木綿布に木綿糸で補強したものが始まりとされている。
sen.e: It started with cotton fabrics reinforced with cotton threads for warmth and strength.

sen.j: 藍色の木綿布に白糸で刺すものが定番であるが、最近では、布/糸ともカラフルな色合いのものもできてきている。
sen.e: Indigo cotton fabrics stitched with white threads are classic, but more colors for both fabrics and threads are available these days.

sen.j: 有名な刺し子技法には津軽地方の『こぎん刺し』、南部地方 (青森県)の『菱刺し』、庄内地方の『庄内刺し子』がある。
sen.e: Famous sashiko techniques include "koginzashi" (an old needlework technology) in Tsugaru region, "hishizashi" (diamond sashiko) in Nanbu region (Aomori prefecture), and "Shonai sashiko" in Shonai region.

sen.j: これらを日本三大刺し子という。
sen.e: They are called three major sashiko in Japan.

sen.j: 田中忠三郎氏が調査・収集した刺し子のうち津軽・南部の刺し子着786点が国の重要有形民俗文化財に指定された。
sen.e: Among sashiko examined and collected by Chuzaburo TANAKA, 786 pieces of sashiko clothes in Tsugaru and Nanbu region are specified to significant tangible folk cultural assets.

sen.e: They are acknowledged as a collection with not only scholarly value, but also high artistic value that meets Chuzaburo TANAKA's peculiar aestheticism.
